column4: what do you, guys, use to view "svgz" files? i'm trying to open one [from http://futurist.se/gldt/ ] with both gthumb and "eye of gnome" but to no avail
noone here succesfully opened a "svgz" file before? :|

i said it before: "what do you, guys, use to view "svgz" files? i'm trying to open one [from http://futurist.se/gldt/ ] with both gthumb and "eye of gnome" but to no avail" & " i opened the "svgz" file with file archiver and it does list one file in the "archive" but it can't extract it"
a quick google suggests that it's a gzipped svg
care to READ what i said?
just for you i'll repeat the third time: `i opened the "svgz" file with file archiver and it does list one file in the "archive" but it can't extract it`
well, maybe you're doing it wrong
wrong how? o opened it with the archiver [the fourth time i repeat it! ]; how can this be wrong?
an archiver probably isn't much good for viewing an svg file
come to that, neither is a bitmap viewer like EOG or gthumb
sorry mate but you must learn to read: i tried to OPEN that file in the archiver [if it's supposed to be an archive] and *it does list one file in the "archive" but it can't extract it*
sorry; i won't answear to you any longer
of course in this case the answer *is* available, and I've already pointed you in the right direction
a couple of people have actually *told* you what to do
opens just fine in Inkscape for me too
